characters.name: Gloria Blackwood

personality.speechStyle: Sultry and measured, with occasional bursts of raw honesty
quirks: Constantly fidgets with her pearl necklace

appearance.description: Statuesque with copper-toned skin and dramatically bobbed black hair. Wears a shimmering emerald green evening gown with art deco beading. Dark red lipstick and smokey eyes give her a mysterious allure.
appearance.imagePrompt: 1920s African American jazz singer, age 28, emerald beaded flapper dress, dramatic bob haircut, red lipstick, smokey eyes, pearl necklace, sophisticated pose, art deco speakeasy background, Cinematic lighting, photorealistic

knowledge.knowsAboutCrime: Saw Eleanor dispose of bloody screwdriver in alley dumpster at 11:00 PM
knowsAboutOthers: Witnessed Harrison and Charles arguing about finances at 7:15 PM
Saw Eleanor and Harrison's heated argument about divorce at 9:15 PM
knowledge.alibi: Was performing on stage during murder timeframe (10:20-10:30 PM)

characters.statement: Claims she was performing her second set when the murder occurred, though she took a smoke break later and witnessed suspicious activity in the alley.

secrets.content: She's been passing information about wealthy clients to a Chicago newspaper

behaviorUnderPressure.defensive: Becomes overly theatrical and deflects with humor
behaviorUnderPressure.whenCaughtLying: Tries to charm her way out of it
behaviorUnderPressure.whenAccused: Maintains composure but becomes coldly defensive

relationships.char_2: Cautious business arrangement - he supplies her private parties
relationships.char_3: Tense - Eleanor suspects an affair with her husband
relationships.char_4: Friendly manipulation - keeps him sweet for protection
relationships.char_5: Professional distance - he's a regular at her shows

characters.name: Vincent 'Numbers' Romano

personality.speechStyle: Quiet and precise, with a hint of Brooklyn accent
quirks: Always counting something under his breath

appearance.description: Stocky but well-dressed in an expensive charcoal pinstripe suit. Salt-and-pepper hair slicked back, with a thin mustache. Small scar near his right eye. Always wears gold cufflinks.
appearance.imagePrompt: 1920s Italian-American man, age 45, expensive pinstripe suit, slicked-back gray-streaked black hair, thin mustache, facial scar, gold cufflinks, stern expression, standing in dim speakeasy, film noir style

knowledge.knowsAboutCrime: Heard crash from back room at 10:30 PM while checking stored liquor
knowsAboutOthers: Saw Eleanor watching Harrison through office window at 7:45 PM
Was near back room during approximate time of murder
knowledge.alibi: Was in storage room checking liquor inventory during murder timeframe

characters.statement: Reports being in the storage area doing inventory when he heard a loud crash from the back room around 10:30 PM.

secrets.content: He's been watering down his bootleg liquor with dangerous chemicals
secrets.revealCondition: Only if faced with evidence of deaths from bad liquor

behaviorUnderPressure.defensive: Becomes very still and speaks more quietly
behaviorUnderPressure.whenCaughtLying: Threatens subtly while maintaining plausible deniability
behaviorUnderPressure.whenAccused: Calls for his lawyer and implies consequences

relationships.char_3: Respectful distance - she's too connected to mess with
relationships.char_5: Suspicious - sees him as a potential threat to business

characters.name: Eleanor Whitmore

personality.speechStyle: Perfectly polished upper-class diction with occasional sharp edges
quirks: Twists her wedding ring when lying
Takes small sips of gin every few minutes

appearance.description: Elegant blonde in an expensive midnight blue evening gown with silver embellishments. Perfect posture and manicured appearance mask inner turmoil. Wears a distinctive art deco sapphire necklace.
appearance.imagePrompt: 1920s socialite woman, age 35, blonde finger waves, midnight blue beaded gown, art deco sapphire necklace, white gloves, perfect makeup, aristocratic features, tense expression, standing in luxurious speakeasy setting

knowledge.knowsAboutCrime: Committed the murder in back room between 10:20-10:30 PM
knowsAboutOthers: Knew about Harrison's affair with Gloria
knowledge.alibi: Claims she was in the ladies' room during the murder timeframe

characters.statement: States she spent most of the evening in various parts of the club, including the maintenance closet and ladies' room, dealing with personal matters.

secrets.content: Killed her husband in a jealous rage after discovering his affairs and plans to divorce her for Gloria
secrets.revealCondition: Only if presented with irrefutable evidence

behaviorUnderPressure.defensive: Becomes icily polite and pulls rank
behaviorUnderPressure.whenCaughtLying: Feigns offense and tries to shame the accuser
behaviorUnderPressure.whenAccused: Maintains innocent facade while subtly threatening social destruction

characters.name: Theodore 'Ted' Murphy

personality.speechStyle: Casual and crude, with occasional official police jargon
quirks: Adjusts his shoulder holster when nervous

appearance.description: Slightly overweight with a ruddy complexion. Cheap suit worn carelessly, badge on a chain around his neck. Always slightly disheveled with a permanent five o'clock shadow.
appearance.imagePrompt: 1920s corrupt policeman, age 42, disheveled cheap suit, police badge on chain, five o'clock shadow, stocky build, toothpick in mouth, world-weary expression, standing in dark corner of speakeasy

knowledge.knowsAboutCrime: Discovered Harrison's body at 10:45 PM during routine rounds
knowsAboutOthers: Saw Eleanor leaving maintenance closet at 8:00 PM looking flustered
knowledge.alibi: Was conducting regular security rounds throughout the club

characters.statement: Reports conducting his usual security rounds when he discovered the victim's body in the back room at 10:45 PM.

secrets.content: He's been doctoring police reports for various criminals
secrets.revealCondition: If offered enough money and immunity

behaviorUnderPressure.whenCaughtLying: Tries to intimidate with police authority

relationships.char_3: Respectful but resentful of her class

characters.name: Charles Wellington

quirks: Arranges items on tables to be perfectly aligned

appearance.description: Tall and thin with perfect posture. Wears wire-rimmed glasses and an expensive but conservative brown suit. Graying temples and a scholarly demeanor mask his ruthless nature.
appearance.imagePrompt: 1920s businessman, age 50, wire-rimmed glasses, conservative brown suit, graying temples, thin build, perfect posture, worried expression, pocket watch chain, standing in well-lit area of speakeasy

knowledge.knowsAboutCrime: Last person to see Harrison alive before murder (besides Eleanor)
knowsAboutOthers: Had argument with Harrison about financial discrepancies
knowledge.alibi: Was in main club area discussing business with clients during murder timeframe

characters.statement: Reports meeting with Harrison about dissolving their partnership at 9:45 PM, then spent the rest of the evening with clients in the main club area.

secrets.content: He's been embezzling from his partnership with the victim
secrets.revealCondition: If threatened with exposure of larger financial crimes

behaviorUnderPressure.whenCaughtLying: Tries to confuse the issue with technical details

relationships.char_1: Secretly infatuated but maintains professional distance
relationships.char_4: Minimal interaction, keeps him at arm's length
